intro: Hieracium sabaudum subsp. occitanicum, commonly known as the Occitanian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring temperate climates. It has lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges and produces numerous small seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
